title: Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia
diagnosis_topic: Neonatal diaphragmatic defect causing pulmonary hypoplasia and respiratory distress
setup_script: A full-term newborn develops severe respiratory distress immediately after birth. The abdomen appears scaphoid and bowel sounds are heard in the chest. The infant was delivered after an uncomplicated pregnancy.

dynamic_flow.reply: HR 170 bpm, RR 60/min, SpO2 80% on blow-by oxygen; baby cyanotic.
Barrel-shaped chest, scaphoid abdomen, decreased breath sounds on left; heart sounds shifted to the right.
Loops of bowel in the left hemithorax with mediastinal shift; no clear diaphragmatic dome.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident immediately intubates and avoids bag-mask ventilation
dynamic_flow.reply: Prevents insufflation of stomach into chest; NG tube placed for decompression.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident starts gentle ventilation with permissive hypercapnia
If resident obtains arterial blood gas
dynamic_flow.reply: Shows respiratory acidosis and hypoxemia; adjust ventilator settings accordingly.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for associated anomalies
dynamic_flow.reply: Echocardiogram to assess pulmonary hypertension and structural heart disease.
Surgical repair delayed until stabilization of pulmonary hypertension, typically within first week.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If patient deteriorates despite maximal ventilatory support
dynamic_flow.reply: Consider extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) as a bridge to surgery.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays intubation and uses bag-mask

dynamic_flow.reply: Prolonged ventilatory support, management of pulmonary hypertension and feeding intolerance.
Explain long-term outcomes including chronic lung disease, gastroesophageal reflux and developmental delays.

critical_decision_points: Immediate airway management and avoidance of bag-mask ventilation
Diagnosis via chest X-ray and physical signs
Stabilization of pulmonary hypertension prior to surgical repair
Consideration of ECMO for refractory respiratory failure
Comprehensive parental counseling and long-term follow-up
